_comment: The data supports the aboutMe page instead of hardcoding content and read using PHP
intro: I am a dedicated computer science graduate making a career change from retail into software development. Keen to learn and wanting to collaborate on front-end projects leading towards full stack capabilities.

Recently I have been working on a project using the Django framework. It is a redesign of an existing static business website where a CMS is included to enable the business advocate full control of content creation. Subsequently the content is dynamically rendered if it exists. It is currently un-hosted.
I also have experience in developing tools in .NET aimed at students, including myself, to improve efficiency in assignment execution and support network learning goals.
In another life I've led multiple retail teams, up to 15 members, and strategised with mid and senior leaders to complete retail working goals within tight time and resource constraints.
skills: Main Languages: C# (.NET Core), Java and Python.
Web development: HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Main databases: MySQL, SQL Express, and SQLite.
Other: Git and Agile development (practiced in group projects).

personal-projects.name: Django website redesign 2023
personal-projects.description: •	Redesigned an existing static business website using Django and Bootstrap 5.
•	Added features such as separate inventory galleries, news blog, contact forms, FAQ section, testimonials, Google Maps integration, and social media functionality.

•	Extended a content management system (CMS) for a business advocate to change 99% of textual content for easier site updates. Includes headers, titles, link titles and icons, business data, and editorial content.
•	Built database with SQLite3, formspree.com for email services, and honeypot application.
•	Optimized original content for grammar, spelling, and image quality.

personal-projects.name: Network Configuration Scriptor 2022-23
personal-projects.description: Designed and implemented a C# .NET Core 3.1 desktop application to create network configuration scripts as text files.
They are used with Telnet & TFTP to update network device configuration files, and backup/restore configuration files on a directly connected
router and in GNS3. Split into 3 decoupled parts, with the first being able to be used
with Packet Tracer. Used GITHUB within IDE for version control. Personally used
during the last year of a degree and presented for the final project.

personal-projects.name: Literature Review Resource 2022
personal-projects.description:
Conceptualised and constructed a C# .NET Core 3.1 desktop application to store and organise module assignments and their respective resources.
                Includes sections such as notes, references, search, and a link for each resource providing an increased efficiency in assignment construction. 
                Used SQL Express (setup script included) with a section for connection string setup, based on MVP, uses singleton design, and utilizes GITHUB for version control. 
                Personally used during the last year of a degree for module assignments and dissertation.

education.edu_result: Awarded 1st Class Honours Degree with all assignments planned, executed, and submitted early with no re-submissions. Modules scored between 70% and 93%.
Awarded Distinction. 1 merit and the rest distinctions.

positions.title: TeamLeader
description: Team-Leader (nights) - Supported department managers by directing up to 15-member teams to meet a nightly 70% store filling split requirement.
Collaborated with 3 other team leaders to complete department objectives and reaffirm the continued value of the role to the business.
Implemented staff training strategies and consistently achieved 100% team compliance with periodical service, health and hygiene, and fire safety company training.
Repeatedly analysed and re-sited fast-moving/promotional items to exceed sales beyond its location capacity and reduce warehouse stock holding by 15%.
Ensured staff rotas and payroll attendance reports were completed thoroughly and on-time to reduce colleague wage discrepancies by 15%.
Instigated personal support to assist the warehouse member by taking in deliveries, delivering stock to and from filling teams, and prepare shop floor in time for day-trading.

positions.title: General Assistant
description: GA (nights) – Replenish, present working area, and organise returns. Additionally coordinated with the stock-control department to drive accurate item system levels for improved customer availability.

positions.title: IBM AS400 Computer Operator
description: Monitored AS400 System and Network Servers for messages and errors.
Created and maintained user profiles on both AS400 System and Network server.
Backed up and restored data on both systems.
Responsible for communications between retail premises and head office and ensured data integrity.
Ensured the completion of scheduled daily/weekly and periodical tasks.
Provided a first line of support service for internal and external users on AS400 system and second line of support for Network users.
Responsible for the maintenance of all AS400 linked hardware.

positions.title: Systems Support Analyst
description: Responsible for the maintenance of branch PCs and tills.
Resolved software errors/issues for branch systems.
Provided a first line of contact service for Head Office systems including AS400 users.
Ensured the completion of all branch accounting on a weekly basis.
Supported branches in all operational issues.
Resolved branch telecommunication faults.
